history.narrative: Law 10-105, the “Displaced Workers Protection Act of 1994,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 10-307, which was referred to the Committee on Labor. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on January 4, 1994, and February 1, 1994, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on February 17, 1994, it was assigned Act No. 10-193 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 10-105 became effective on April 26, 1994.
